_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Specialized Freight (except Used Goods) Trucking, Long-Distance

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Grammer Logistics, Inc. - Rocky Mount Facility complies with the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) #58 (2017 Edition) for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage, and it is this facility's policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws/codes. If an emergency were to occur, it is the facility's policy to notify the Rocky Mount Fire Department as well as Nash County Emergency Management and/or LEPC, as necessary. Medical emergencies will require notification of the Rocky Mount Fire Department.



The Grammer Logistics, Inc. - Rocky Mount Facility is a butane transloading facility (specifically, railcar to truck tanker). This Risk Management Plan (RMP) covers the butane railcar storage and transloading system only, including the associated piping and storage for up to twenty-five (25) storage tanks (detached railcars).



The Grammer Logistics, Inc. - Rocky Mount Facility complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) accident prevention rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D) and the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) Standard (29 CFR Part 1910.119). This butane railcar storage and transloading system is designed, constructed and maintained in accordance with NFPA #58 and the manufacturer's (Westmor) instructions. Railcars meet the U.S. Department of Transportation Federal Railroad Administration design requirements for pressurized tank cars.



This is a new facility; therefore, it has never had an accident involving butane which has resulted in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuation or sheltering in-place.



In the event of an emergency involving the Grammer Logistics, Inc. - Rocky Mount Facility butane railcar storage and transloading system, it is the policy of the facility to initially contact the Rocky Mount Fire Department and request their assistance. The facility personnel are trained. The facility emergency response plan is coordinated with the fire depar

tment and Nash County Emergency Management and/or LEPC. The Rocky Mount Fire Department is aware of the system and its available fire protection systems (site fire extinguishers and emergency shut-off devices). The primary hazardous materials response capabilities are provided by the Rocky Mount Fire Department.



Improvement actions to be considered primarily focus on site security and rail safety measures including continuing safety audits and safety inspections.
